chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry T. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry T. Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Larry T. Johnson was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 21CF43.
Credit for 69 days if revoked.
Expungement request is reserved.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry T. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Completion of Representation
Submitted by Atty FrancescoBalistrieri
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

09:23 AM
Defendant Larry T. Johnson appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.  Defendant in custody
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Def. is currently serving a two year sentence.
Defendant admits to prior convictions and entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1-Fel Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, Repeater;
Found guilty by the court.  Cts 2, 3, 4, 5 were dismissed outright and case 22CM347 was dismissed and read-in on State's motion.
Parties waived the PSI report and proceeded to sentencing:
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions;
To run concurrent to 21CF43 case.
69 days sentence credit if revoked.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.
Expungement request is reserved.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant, Larry T. Johnson, appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
